block.p: Julie Beth Birnbaum and Lawrence Joachim Duffy were married on Friday at the Burden Mansion in New York by the Rev. Susanna Stefanachi Macomb, an interfaith minister.

Mr. and Mrs. Duffy work in the office furniture industry in New York, she as a market manager for Steelcase, a manufacturer, and he as a vice president and a sales manager at AFD Contract Furniture, a sales company.
Julie Beth Birnbaum and Lawrence Joachim Duffy were married on Friday at the Burden Mansion in New York by the Rev. Susanna Stefanachi Macomb, an interfaith minister.

Mr. and Mrs. Duffy work in the office furniture industry in New York, she as a market manager for Steelcase, a manufacturer, and he as a vice president and a sales manager at AFD Contract Furniture, a sales company.

The bride, 34, graduated from Dickinson College. She is the daughter of Robert J. Birnbaum of Ridgewood, N.J., and the late Joy E. Birnbaum, and the stepdaughter of Gloria Birnbaum. Mrs. Duffy's father, a director of the Chicago Board Options Exchange, was the president of the American Stock Exchange from 1977 to 1985 and of the New York Stock Exchange from 1985 to 1988.

The bridegroom, 39, graduated from Temple University, from which he also received a master's degree in geology. His previous marriage ended in divorce. He is a son of the late Joan and James Duffy. His father was the senior vice president of AFD.
